text: In mathematics, a fusion category is a category that is rigid, semisimple, k-linear, monoidal and has only finitely many isomorphism classes of simple objects, such that the monoidal unit is simple. If the ground field k is algebraically closed, then the latter is equivalent to \mathrm{Hom}(1,1)\cong k by Schur's lemma. ==Examples== * Representation Category of a finite group ==Reconstruction== Under Tannaka-Krein duality, every fusion category arises as the representations of a weak Hopf algebra. title: Fusion category
